Description: Three fragments (two joined) of the body of a red pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a burnished cream-coloured slip and with traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents as wine of the Aten domain from the western river.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:21-22/170 Workmen's Village
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I:164 pl.LXIII, fig.J
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393162) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393162)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Domain of Aten
